So far, Steven Tyler has been a pretty striking presence on "Idol', says Richard Rushfield, author of "American Idol: The Untold Story". "He's a wild character, and he's pretty much pushed Simon Cowell out of people"s minds in just two weeks."

to be a lot of fun once he settles in. He likes to joke, drum on the desk to the music and sing along when he likes someone. He has a flirtatious streak, too. Where is your pitchfork, you little devil, he said to one cutie. The frontman for Aerosmith also has a little Simon Cowell in him. "Did you eat a lot of paint chips as a child?" he asked a gruesome singer.

for taxes. "There's this worry about the optics of all that. I understand that- voters don't want to be threatened, and voters shouldn't be threatened," Bill Lockyer said. However, you also have to be honest with them about what the consequences will be if the only policy option is an all-cut budget. And no one has yet produced that. Jon Fleischman, publisher of the popular conservative political blog FlashReport.org and a vice chairman of the California Republican Party, said he wants to see what an all-cuts budget would actually look like. Allen Iverson 's biggest assist to Chris Webber didn't come on a no-look pass. It came in words of encouragement to Philly's slumping newcomer. "Just get your swagger back," Chris Webber said Allen Iverson told him. Reggie Jackson 's really what I did. It helped me out. Chris Webber had his best performance in his four games with Philadelphia, scoring 24 points and grabbing 12 rebounds, and Allen Iverson added 31 points to lead the 76ers to a 98-89 win over the James Cleveland Cavaliers on Friday night

her "brand" with fans. England footballer Ashley, Cheryl Cole , 27, had continued to travel and book hotels under her maiden name. Last night a source close to the X Factor host said: Cheryl Cole considered going back to her maiden name but now she has dismissed the idea. People knew who she was as a Cheryl Cole but she has only become truly famous as Cheryl Cole . yet but seeds have been sown by people like Black Eyed Peas singer Will.i.am and it is important she creates a lasting brand. It would be madness to change back. The Sunday Mirror can also confirm that Simon Cowell has promised her a job as a judge on the US X Factor. He has spent the past few days convincing American producers that she will be a huge success.

Kirsten Gillibrand 's plan would create a permanent 20 percent research and development tax credit that could impact more than 2,000 businesses and spur job growth across the nation.
